snippet: Some members of the ruling Communist Party fear that popular anger over territorial claims could bleed into a broader protest movement.
abstract: Anti-China march in Vietnamese capital city of Hanoi highlights domestic pressure faced by government when dealing with China's muscular approach to territorial claims in South China Sea; some members of ruling Communist Party fear that popular anger over China, nation’s ideological ally and biggest trading partner, could easily bleed into a broader protest movement against Vietnam's own government.
lead_paragraph: Some members of the ruling Communist Party fear that popular anger over territorial claims could bleed into a broader protest movement.

headline.seo: Rare Protest in Vietnam Raises Call to Curb China
headline.main: Rare Protest in Vietnam Raises a Call to Curb China
headline.print_headline: Rare Protest In Vietnam Raises a Call To Curb China
